intro: Craibia filipes, commonly known as the featherleaf craibia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that give it its common name. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Craibia filipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
